Courses.name: Introduction to Psychology
Courses.syllabus: Exploration of basic concepts in psychology and human behavior.
Courses.objectives: Gain understanding of psychological principles, apply concepts to everyday life.

Courses.name: Statistics for Social Sciences
Courses.syllabus: Introduction to statistical methods for analyzing social science data.
Courses.objectives: Learn statistical techniques, interpret data, and draw conclusions.
Courses.requiredMaterials: Textbook: 'Statistics for Social Sciences', Graphing Calculator

Courses.name: Principles of Microeconomics
Courses.syllabus: Study of individual economic behavior and markets.
Courses.objectives: Understand basic economic concepts, analyze market behavior.

Courses.name: World History: Ancient Civilizations
Courses.syllabus: Examination of ancient civilizations and their contributions to world history.
Courses.objectives: Explore the development of ancient societies, understand cultural exchange.
Courses.requiredMaterials: Textbook: 'The Story of Civilization: Volume I - The Ancient World', Notebook

Courses.name: Introduction to Biology
Courses.syllabus: Overview of biological concepts including cellular structure and genetics.
Courses.objectives: Develop understanding of basic biological principles, explore life processes.
Courses.requiredMaterials: Textbook: 'Biology: Concepts and Connections', Laboratory Kit

Courses.name: Spanish Language and Culture
Courses.syllabus: Introduction to Spanish language, culture, and communication.
Courses.objectives: Acquire basic language skills, explore Hispanic culture.
Courses.requiredMaterials: Textbook: '¡Dímelo tú!: A Complete Course', Spanish-English Dictionary

Courses.name: Art History: Renaissance to Modernism
Courses.syllabus: Survey of art movements from the Renaissance to the early 20th century.
Courses.objectives: Examine artistic styles, understand historical context of artworks.
Courses.requiredMaterials: Textbook: 'Gardner's Art through the Ages: A Global History', Notebook

Courses.name: Introduction to Environmental Science
Courses.syllabus: Overview of environmental issues and their scientific foundations.
Courses.objectives: Understand ecological principles, explore human impact on the environment.
Courses.requiredMaterials: Textbook: 'Environmental Science: Toward a Sustainable Future', Notebook

Courses.name: Introduction to Philosophy
Courses.syllabus: Exploration of fundamental philosophical questions and concepts.
Courses.objectives: Develop critical thinking skills, analyze philosophical arguments.

Courses.name: Introduction to Marketing
Courses.syllabus: Overview of marketing principles and strategies.
Courses.objectives: Understand consumer behavior, explore marketing techniques.
